name: USizeBox
doc:
A widget that allows you to specify the size it reports to have and desire.  Not all widgets report a desired size
that you actually desire.  Wrapping them in a SizeBox lets you have the Size Box force them to be a particular size.

* Single Child
* Fixed Size

WidthOverride: When specified, ignore the content's desired size and report the WidthOverride as the Box's desired width.
HeightOverride: When specified, ignore the content's desired size and report the HeightOverride as the Box's desired height.
MinDesiredWidth: When specified, will report the MinDesiredWidth if larger than the content's desired width.
MinDesiredHeight: When specified, will report the MinDesiredHeight if larger than the content's desired height.
MaxDesiredWidth: When specified, will report the MaxDesiredWidth if smaller than the content's desired width.
MaxDesiredHeight: When specified, will report the MaxDesiredHeight if smaller than the content's desired height.

methods.name: SetHeightOverride
methods.doc: When specified, ignore the content's desired size and report the HeightOverride as the Box's desired height.

methods.name: SetMaxDesiredHeight
methods.doc: When specified, will report the MaxDesiredHeight if smaller than the content's desired height.

methods.name: SetMaxDesiredWidth
methods.doc: When specified, will report the MaxDesiredWidth if smaller than the content's desired width.

methods.name: SetMinDesiredHeight
methods.doc: When specified, will report the MinDesiredHeight if larger than the content's desired height.

methods.name: SetMinDesiredWidth
methods.doc: When specified, will report the MinDesiredWidth if larger than the content's desired width.

methods.name: SetWidthOverride
methods.doc: When specified, ignore the content's desired size and report the WidthOverride as the Box's desired width.
